snippet: Ms. Mosby, who on Friday announced criminal charges against six police officers in Mr. Gray’s death, took office only four months ago, elected with the backing of community activists.
abstract: Marilyn J Mosby, Maryland state's attorney for city of Baltimore, finds herself in national spotlight following contentious decision to prosecute six police officers in death of Freddie Gray; youngest top prosecutor in any major American city, Mosby says her own experiences growing up black in a tough area of Boston have shaped her concepts of justice as much as the fact that she comes from a family of police officers.

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and ALAN BLINDER

lead_paragraph: Ms. Mosby, who on Friday announced criminal charges against six police officers in Mr. Gray’s death, took office only four months ago, elected with the backing of community activists.

headline.main: Marilyn Mosby, Prosecutor in Freddie Gray Case, Takes a Stand and Calms a Troubled City
headline.print_headline: A Rookie Prosecutor Takes a Stand and Surprises a Troubled City
